title: Brittney Griner Pleads Guilty to Drug Charges in Russia
abstract: Her plea came hours after a Russian diplomat said that publicity around the basketball player’s case was not helping her interests.
byline: By Anton Troianovski and Ivan Nechepurenko

multimedia.caption: Brittney Griner arriving for a court hearing near Moscow on Thursday. She pleaded guilty to drug charges.
Brittney Griner arriving for a court hearing near Moscow on Thursday. She pleaded guilty to drug charges.
Brittney Griner arriving for a court hearing near Moscow on Thursday. She pleaded guilty to drug charges.

title: Doubles Tennis Is Wimbledon’s Best Kept (and Most Fun) Secret
abstract: Doubles takes a back seat to the singles game on both tours, but famous players like Coco Gauff revel in the variety, pace and joy of tennis’s hidden gem.

multimedia.caption: Coco Gauff paired with Jack Sock after he responded to a message she posted on Twitter.
Coco Gauff paired with Jack Sock after he responded to a message she posted on Twitter.
Coco Gauff paired with Jack Sock after he responded to a message she posted on Twitter.

title: Mike Grier, the N.H.L.’s First Black General Manager, Started as a College Benchwarmer
abstract: Grier worked from being a reserve at Boston University to an N.H.L. mainstay. Now the league’s first Black general manager hopes to rebuild the Sharks and “open some doors for someone to follow.”

multimedia.caption: Mike Grier was introduced on Tuesday as the general manager of the San Jose Sharks, one of the teams he played for over a 14-season N.H.L. career. His hiring came just two days before the draft.
Mike Grier was introduced on Tuesday as the general manager of the San Jose Sharks, one of the teams he played for over a 14-season N.H.L. career. His hiring came just two days before the draft.
Mike Grier was introduced on Tuesday as the general manager of the San Jose Sharks, one of the teams he played for over a 14-season N.H.L. career. His hiring came just two days before the draft.

title: Kyrgios, Under a Hotter Spotlight, Stays Quiet and Wins Again
abstract: A day after the emergence of allegations that he assaulted a former girlfriend, Kyrgios found a way to advance to a Wimbledon semifinal but declined to address the accusations afterward.

multimedia.caption: Nick Kyrgios after winning match point against Cristian Garin on Wednesday.
Nick Kyrgios after winning match point against Cristian Garin on Wednesday.
Nick Kyrgios after winning match point against Cristian Garin on Wednesday.

title: Will Nadal Be Ready for His Wimbledon Semifinal and Kyrgios?
abstract: Nadal struggled with an abdominal injury in his grueling quarterfinal victory over Taylor Fritz, a rising American star who pushed Nadal to five sets.

multimedia.caption: Rafael Nadal after beating Taylor Fritz to advance to the men’s singles semifinal.
Rafael Nadal after beating Taylor Fritz to advance to the men’s singles semifinal.

title: Jake Paul Gets New Opponent After Tommy Fury’s Travel Troubles
abstract: Fury was denied entry to the United States as his family faces questions about connections to Daniel Kinahan, a promoter who the U.S. says is also the head of a drug cartel.

multimedia.caption: Jake Paul will face Hasim Rahman Jr., a former sparring partner who is 12-1 as a pro boxer.

title: What’s the Most Curious and Fraught Job in Tennis?
abstract: Coaches in tennis have one of the odder existences in sports. Some players go for long periods without even using one, and others change coaches like socks.

multimedia.caption: Simona Halep, with a new coach this year, faces Amanda Anisimova in a quarterfinal match on Wednesday.
Simona Halep, with a new coach this year, faces Amanda Anisimova in a quarterfinal match on Wednesday.

title: Yankees’ Update on Aaron Judge: There Will Be No Updates
abstract: Hal Steinbrenner, the team’s managing general partner, said he, like Judge, did not want any contract-related distractions while the team pursued a championship. But he wouldn’t mind more pitching.

multimedia.caption: The Yankees’ offer to Aaron Judge in spring training was $213.5 million for seven years. His value has presumably gone up, but he said he did not want to negotiate during the regular season.

title: A Prized Recruit Shows the Shoe Circuit Is Not the Only Path
abstract: Xavier Booker, in an unusual move, is sidestepping the carnival of tournaments put on by shoe companies to showcase elite men’s basketball players.

title: Nick Kyrgios to Appear in Court on Assault Allegation in Australia
abstract: The accusation landed on the eve of perhaps the most important match of Kyrgios’s controversy-filled career, a quarterfinal showdown with Cristian Garín.

title: Will Euro 2022 Be the Payoff on England’s Investment in Women’s Soccer?
abstract: At least a half-dozen nations will arrive at this summer’s European Championship thinking they can lift the trophy. But the pressure to win might be the highest on the host nation.

title: An N.F.L. Star’s C.T.E. Diagnosis Offers Only Partial Insight
abstract: Demaryius Thomas had C.T.E. when he died in December at 33, but the posthumous diagnosis alone does not explain what role football had in the charismatic N.F.L. star’s quick decline.

multimedia.caption: When Thomas left the field after Super Bowl 50, he had a headache so bad that he missed most of the celebrations after.

title: The Knicks Stumbled Last Season. Here’s How They Can Recover.
abstract: With free agency beginning, the Knicks have several options to build on what’s working and to move on from what is not.

title: Biden Speaks to Cherelle Griner About Her Wife’s Detention in Russia
abstract: President Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris told Cherelle Griner they would pursue “every avenue” to bring her wife, Brittney Griner, home from Russia.

abstract: The alliance made it easier for players to compete in more tournaments, but the new golf tour is testing the partnership.

title: The Rise of the Professional-Athlete Podcast
abstract: Does getting game analyses straight from the source take away some of the magic?

title: Much More Than Bragging Rights at the Next Barbecue Are at Stake
abstract: Neither Tatjana Maria nor Ons Jabeur had been to a Grand Slam singles semifinal until this week. The close friends will play each other at Wimbledon on Thursday for a place in the final.

multimedia.caption: Tatjana Maria, 34, beat her 22-year-old German compatriot Jule Niemeier to advance to the semifinal. Both had made surprise runs deep into the tournament.

abstract: Two days before the annual draft, Grier takes over a team in transition: San Jose missed the past three postseasons and recently fired its coach.

title: For U.S. Women’s Team, One Tournament Offers Two Prizes

title: In Wimbledon’s Queue, Waiting Is a Pleasure, and the Point
abstract: In a world of online ticketing, camping overnight for tennis seats is an anachronism, but it is also about community and a sense of belonging.
byline: By Christopher Clarey and Adam Stoltman

multimedia.caption: Would-be ticket holders are issued a card with a number when they arrive at Wimbledon Park. The lower the number, the higher your priority for entrance into the All England Club.

title: Brittney Griner to Biden: ‘I’m Terrified I Might Be Here Forever’
abstract: Griner, the W.N.B.A. star, sent a letter to President Biden on Monday, asking him to help free her from prison in Russia. She has been in custody since February.
byline: By Shauntel Lowe, Michael D. Shear and Euan Ward

multimedia.caption: Brittney Griner, the W.N.B.A. star, being escorted to a courtroom outside Moscow on Friday. She said in a letter to President Biden on the Fourth of July that “freedom means something completely different to me this year.”

abstract: Kyrgios, the big, talented Australian, has taken over Wimbledon with his antics and psychological warfare. It’s working.

title: The Mets May Finally Get Their Aces Back
abstract: Jacob deGrom’s first rehab start went well, and Max Scherzer is slated to return to the starting rotation on Tuesday. Will that be enough to offset an offensive downturn?

title: Longing for Roger Federer at Wimbledon
abstract: Federer said he hoped to return to the tournament he has won eight times before. His absence from the field this year left a void over Wimbledon’s early rounds.

title: A 2,700-Mile Cycling Race Is Now Even More Extreme
abstract: The Tour Divide, a bikepacking race from the Canadian Rockies to the U.S. border with Mexico, has always been a test of fortitude. But extreme weather is making it much more dangerous.

title: When Will Federer and the Williams Sisters Call It Quits? Maybe Never.
abstract: Advances in physical preparation keep their bodies in the game, and so can the changing nature of sports business and celebrity.

abstract: “It’s a new position that I’m in, and I’m trying to use it the best way possible,” Swiatek said. She announced an exhibition match to help raise money for young Ukrainians.
